noun.description: Fraud or gross negligence of a ship's master or crew at the expense of its owners or users.
synonyms: lack of proper care and attention

noun.description: Vexatious litigation or incitement to it.
Trade in the sale of Church or state appointments.

origin: Late Middle English (in barratry (sense 3)): from Old French baraterie, from barater deceive, based on Greek prattein do, perform, manage (sometimes dishonestly); perhaps influenced by Old Norse barátta contest.
